snippet: Television campaign advertisements are reaching fewer people. But tracking Web activity makes it easier to find the right audience online.
abstract: Mitt Romney's campaign will release two of its Wisconsin television advertisements online, in the hopes of reaching the growing number of voters who watch television through Web browsers or DVRs; move signals a potential shift in the economics of political advertising, as tracking technology allows candidates to target blocs of viewers who are most likely to sympathize with their views.
lead_paragraph: Television campaign advertisements are reaching fewer people. But tracking Web activity makes it easier to find the right audience online.

headline.seo: As TV Viewing Habits Change, Political Ads Adapt
headline.main: As Viewing Habits Change, Political Ads Switch Screens
headline.print_headline: As TV Viewing Habits Change, Political Ads Follow Would-Be Voters Online
